item.description:
Sounds of Concord will again be offering free* group voice classes for men who sing and who wish to become better singers. If you are a guy or know a guy who enjoys singing, this is a great program!

The program is sponsored by Sounds of Concord, an award winning men's a cappella chorus, and will consist of 4 classes on Thursday nights beginning Thursday January 7th, and continuing on January 14, 21 and 28.

A short session for registration, class overview, and determination of voice range will be held January 7th, 7:00pm at Temple Emunah, 9 Piper Road in Lexington Mass. (off Waltham Street) . The first lesson will follow after that session.

Classes will be taught by Steve Tramack, former director of the Nashua Granite Statesmen, and baritone of Breakaway, a Top 5 quartet in the Northeastern District of the Barbershop Harmony Society . Topics will include breath support, improving resonance, vowel matching, and other methods to improve vocal production. Music will be taught using learning tapes, so you don't have to read music!

For further details or to pre-register contact:

E-mail: sing@soundsofconcord.org

*A $10. materials fee is the only cost. There is no other obligation.
item.how_to_find_us: We are upstairs and to the left.

group.name: Boston Area Acapella Barbershop Quartet/Chorus Singing

item.name: Free Voice Classes for Men #4
